comment: Grade is based on discussion posts, labs, and tests. The tests are two parts multiple choice(lockdown no camera) and take-home coding portion. You have a lab about every two weeks, and you have a discussion posts every week. As long as you do the assignments(I didn't do all of them) you should get a good grade.

She's really nice, will answer questions through email. Posted videos at the beginning but then once the material  got harder and I needed the videos she stopped posting them. Test questions were a little confusing. Discussions were boring, but not that hard. Overall, not a hard course just boring and labs didn't use the concepts learned at the end

There wasn't much to the class (IT 1114/1114L), and the rubrics could be a little confusing. Grading took a while, but she provided feedback. She responded to e-mails fairly quickly, and wanted to make sure you understood the material. She would send you corrections if you ask so you can correlate the feedback to the mistakes you may have made.

Actual nightmare of a course. Worst I have taken in college. 5 quizzes that are made up of only 9-10 questions make up 50% of your grade. These quizzes are littered with typos and incorrect answers, sometimes not even relating to the class. The class was majority writing and not HTML, more than most English classes. Does not respond. Please avoid.

This is my second time taking her, and she has not improved at all. She did not grade things on time, and her rubrics were usually unclear. Her quizzes/tests were lockdown browser, no webcam, and you didn't get to see your grade right away. WOULD NOT TAKE HER EVER.

Overall, not a helpful teacher. There were weekly modules with content and discussion posts. She sometimes included videos that showed you how to code for that module, but you usually had to look at other sources to really understand the coding. Took forever to respond to emails!!! Tests are lockdown browser, no camera.
this class made me no longer want to be on this earth. AVOID!!!!!
She does not teach, do not take this class unless you already are proficient in coding. She expects students to reach online tutorials to know how to code. Also takes forever to grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: This professor is useless. She is only there to grade your work and that's it. She does not teach at all. She says the textbook isn't required and yet expects you to read it and makes test questions from the book. She gives me mad old Karen vibes. Be ready to teach yourself everything- literally everything. the CCSE department at KSU is a joke.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Be ready to teach yourself using YouTube videos. Or get a really good tutor outside of the school- the CCSE tutoring is useless and full of people with no social skills. The professor says to not use ALL CAPS bc its like yelling but then turns around and uses all caps in her lectures. Takes a while to get a grade back. only taking bc its required.

If you take this prof online prepare to teach yourself. Lack of communication when due dates are changed, she won't reply to emails for days, and there are no lectures explaining the core material within the power points. Only 2-3 vaguely narrated example videos are included within each module . If you're a newbie to programming pick someone else.
This class was unnecessarily difficult and gives confusing assignments that are written poorly.

While I'm sure the professor knows the material, she does a horrible job at explaining it. The tutorials provided are semi-helpful, and that's being nice, but they will not be of much help when it is time for labs. Unless you have prior experience in programming I would not recommend this class lest it become your thirteenth reason why.

I just took the lab portion, she is a very slow grader and also she responds to e-mails very slowly.. she offers feedback on each lab but nothing on how to fix it.. she also takes points off on pseudocode even if the actual lab itself is running.

Professor Brown is really a facilitator. She rarely provides material outside Pearson (which don't always explain well), even though each module has a survey in which I've requested outside material. Several typos in quizzes, but two attempts for each. She will let you resubmit if you ask. If programming is challenging for you, do not take her.
Lynda Brown is knowledgeable and definitely knows the material. Communication was an issue with the online class. Just go into it knowing that you will be self teaching through reading and practice.
Horrible teacher. She doesn't reply to emails right away or at all. Expect to teach yourself. Make sure to check D2L daily because she won't announce any date changes. Try another professor!

This class can be easy if you do your work and outside practice, otherwise dont expect to learn much if taken online. The professor doesnt respond emails in a timely matter and just lacks on communication. If you ask a question, you might not get the answer until that module is over, and takes a long time to grade assignments. Online class!
She is amazing would recommend her to all!
